key_terms.term_description: Rate on Line (ROL) for each layer
key_terms.rationale: The proposed ROLs (18%, 12%, 8%) are at or above the upper end of current market benchmarks (16-19%, 10-13%, 7-9%)

key_terms.term_description: Exclusion for named storms that have entered the Gulf of Mexico prior to attachment
key_terms.rationale: This is an overly broad exclusion that significantly reduces coverage for a key exposure area (Southeast represents 30% of portfolio)
Reduction from unlimited reinstatements to limited reinstatements (2 free for Layer 1, 1 at 100% for Layer 2, 1 at 125% for Layer 3) is more restrictive than market standards

key_terms.term_description: Minimum premium at 85% of annual premium
key_terms.rationale: This is favorable as it provides some premium certainty in case of early termination
Extended from 14 days to 30 days provides more operational flexibility

pros: Higher attachment point for Layer 1 reduces frequency of claims
Lower ROLs across all layers reduce premium costs
cons: Reduced limit for Layer 3 decreases coverage for extreme events
Higher attachment for Layer 3 may leave more exposure uncovered

pros: Lower premium costs than current structure
Higher retention for Layer 1 aligns with market trends
cons: Increased retention may strain capital for more frequent events

pros: More favorable reinstatement terms for Layer 1

premium_rates.target: Layer 1: 16% ROL, Layer 2: 11% ROL, Layer 3: 7% ROL
premium_rates.minimum: Layer 1: 17% ROL, Layer 2: 11.5% ROL, Layer 3: 7.5% ROL

gulf_exclusion.target: Remove the Gulf of Mexico exclusion entirely
gulf_exclusion.minimum: Limit exclusion to storms with named hurricane status while in Gulf

reinstatements.target: Layer 1: 3 free reinstatements, Layer 2: 1 at 75%, Layer 3: 1 at 100%
reinstatements.minimum: Layer 1: 2 free reinstatements, Layer 2: 1 at 85%, Layer 3: 1 at 110%

minimum_premium.minimum: Accept 90% if other terms improve significantly

claims_notification.minimum: Accept 21-day notification if other terms improve significantly

concessions.concession_item: Accept slightly higher attachment point for Layer 1 ($7.5M instead of $5M)
concessions.rationale: This aligns with market trends and reduces frequency of small claims while maintaining meaningful coverage

concessions.concession_item: Agree to more frequent exposure reporting (monthly instead of quarterly)
concessions.rationale: Provides reassurance to reinsurer about exposure management without materially affecting coverage

concessions.concession_item: Accept a slightly longer sunset clause (42 months instead of 36)
concessions.rationale: This is a relatively minor concession that may help secure more important terms

key_points: Acknowledge their concerns about Southeast exposure concentration and hurricane loss trends
Highlight our improved underwriting and risk management since the 2020/2022 losses
Note that our current terms are above market benchmarks in several areas
Express willingness to work collaboratively on mutually beneficial terms
Request clarification on the rationale for the Gulf of Mexico exclusion

proposed_modifications.current_language: Layer 1: 18% ROL, Layer 2: 12% ROL, Layer 3: 8% ROL
proposed_modifications.proposed_language: Layer 1: 16.5% ROL, Layer 2: 11% ROL, Layer 3: 7.5% ROL
proposed_modifications.justification: Brings rates closer to market benchmarks while still reflecting our loss experience

proposed_modifications.current_language: Losses from named storms that have entered the Gulf of Mexico prior to attachment
proposed_modifications.proposed_language: Losses from named hurricanes (Category 1 or higher) that have entered the Gulf of Mexico prior to attachment
proposed_modifications.justification: Narrows the exclusion to only the most severe storms while still addressing reinsurer concerns

proposed_modifications.current_language: Layer 1: Two free reinstatements, Layer 2: One reinstatement at 100% of pro-rata premium, Layer 3: One reinstatement at 125% of pro-rata premium
proposed_modifications.proposed_language: Layer 1: Three free reinstatements, Layer 2: One reinstatement at 85% of pro-rata premium, Layer 3: One reinstatement at 110% of pro-rata premium
proposed_modifications.justification: Provides more realistic reinstatement provisions given our historical loss frequency and current market conditions
